message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
int[] scores = {40,40,40,10};
Integer[] rank = new Integer[scores.length];
Map<Integer, List<Integer>> scorePositions = new HashMap<>();
for (int i = 0; i < scores.length; i++) {
    if (!scorePositions.containsKey(scores[i])) {
        scorePositions.put(scores[i], new ArrayList<>());
    }
    scorePositions.get(scores[i]).add(i);
}
Integer[] sortedScores = Arrays.stream(scores).boxed().toArray(Integer[]::new);
Arrays.sort(sortedScores, Collections.reverseOrder());
int currentRank = 1;
for (Integer score : sortedScores) {
    List<Integer> positions = scorePositions.get(score);
    for (Integer pos : positions) {
        rank[pos] = currentRank;
    }
    currentRank += positions.size();
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code first creates a map where the keys are the scores and the values are lists of positions where those scores appear in the original array. Then it sorts the scores in descending order. It then iterates over the sorted scores, and for each score, it assigns the current rank to all positions where that score appears. The rank is then incremented by the number of positions that score appears at. This ensures that if multiple players have the same score, they get the same rank, and the next rank is skipped.
